Exaggerate: The claim that "We have signed more legislation than anybody" is an exaggeration, as it has been proven false by data from govtrack.us.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is contradicted by data from govtrack.us, which shows that Trump ranked last in legislation signed among post-World War II presidents in their first calendar year.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Trump did not break the record of Harry Truman in terms of legislation signed.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that signing more legislation is a measure of success or achievement, without considering the quality or impact of the legislation.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that Trump's claim may be based on a different metric or interpretation of legislation signed, but this is not supported by the evidence provided.
